early.description: Born into a family with a history of military service, you were enrolled in a corporate-sponsored youth training program at a young age.
At age seven, you witnessed a training accident that resulted in the injury of a friend, instilling in you the importance of discipline and safety.
You excelled in physical education, showing exceptional agility and coordination compared to your peers.
A family member's disappearance under mysterious circumstances fueled your desire to uncover corporate secrets.
You hacked into a restricted training simulator, demonstrating both your intelligence and disregard for rules.
Bullied by older cadets, you learned to rely on your agility and wit to avoid confrontation.
An instructor recognized your potential and pushed you harder than others, both a blessing and a curse.
You formed a close friendship with a fellow cadet, vowing to watch each other's backs no matter what.
You suffered a minor injury during training, teaching you resilience and the importance of proper technique.
A disciplinary action for breaking curfew left you with a tarnished record, motivating you to prove yourself.
You discovered a hidden talent for marksmanship during a training exercise.
An older cadet took you under their wing, teaching you survival skills not included in the official curriculum.
You participated in a simulated mission that felt too real, leaving a lasting impression on your psyche.
Your family moved frequently due to corporate assignments, making it hard to form lasting relationships.
You stumbled upon confidential files detailing unethical experiments, sparking distrust in corporate motives.
A natural aptitude for technology led you to modify standard-issue equipment, improving performance.
You developed a rivalry with another cadet, pushing both of you to excel but also causing tension.

mid.description: You were selected for an advanced training program due to your exceptional performance.
A training mission went wrong, resulting in casualties; you grappled with guilt and questions about leadership.
You led a team in a simulated urban combat scenario, showcasing tactical thinking and quick reflexes.
An injury sidelined you from physical training, leading you to focus on strategic studies.
You uncovered evidence of corruption among the training staff, forcing you to choose between exposure and self-preservation.
A romantic relationship with a fellow cadet complicated your focus and priorities.
You participated in a clandestine operation, gaining real-world experience but at a moral cost.
An evaluation deemed you unfit for command, challenging your self-image and goals.
You developed an addiction to performance-enhancing substances, affecting your health and judgment.
A close friend was expelled under suspicious circumstances, fueling your mistrust of the system.
You excelled in zero-gravity combat training, a niche skill highly valued by corporate forces.
Assigned to a remote training facility, you uncovered secrets that challenged your loyalty.
You designed a new tactical maneuver that was incorporated into the training curriculum.
An ethical dilemma arose when ordered to participate in a questionable experiment.
You suffered from recurring nightmares due to the stresses of training, affecting your performance.
You began mentoring junior cadets, finding purpose in guiding others.
A confrontation with a superior officer tested your boundaries and forced you to make a stand.

late.description: You graduated at the top of your class, but the cost was a loss of personal relationships.
Assigned to a frontline unit, you faced real combat and the harsh realities of war.
You led a successful mission that saved many lives, earning commendations but also envy.
A catastrophic mission failure left you as the sole survivor, leading to investigations and self-doubt.
You uncovered a plot against high-ranking officials, forcing you into a web of intrigue.
Offered a position in a covert operations unit, you had to choose between transparency and secrecy.
A serious injury forced you to reconsider your path, leading to new opportunities or retirement.
You began to question the corporate motives behind military actions, sparking internal conflict.
A reunion with your estranged family opened old wounds and complicated your future plans.
You trained a new squad of recruits, passing on your knowledge but facing generational differences.
An opportunity to defect to a rival corporation or faction presented itself, testing your loyalty.
You were implicated in a scandal, whether justly or unjustly, affecting your career trajectory.
A technological advancement you advocated for backfired, causing unintended consequences.
You authored a tactical manual that gained widespread use, but not without controversy.
An internal power struggle forced you to choose sides, affecting your standing within the organization.
You faced a moral crisis when ordered to carry out actions conflicting with your principles.
Disillusioned, you considered leaving the military life for a different path.
